record.title: RECOGNIZING THE 100TH BIRTHDAY OF LYNDON BAINES JOHNSON
record.narrative:
RECOGNIZING THE 100TH BIRTHDAY OF LYNDON BAINES JOHNSON -- (Senate - May 20, 2008)

[Page: S4555]

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that we now look at the Judiciary Committee and discharge that committee from further consideration of H. Con. Res. 354.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
record.narrative: The clerk will report the concurrent resolution by title.
The legislative clerk read as follows:
A concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 354) recognizing the 100th birthday of Lyndon Baines Johnson, 36th President, designer of the Great Society, politician, educator, and civil rights enforcer.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the concurrent resolution.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that the concurrent resolution be agreed to, the preamble be agreed to, the motions to reconsider be laid on the table, with no intervening action or debate, and any statements relating to this matter be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 354) was agreed to.
